Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Board is the class that keeps information about the "Island Board" (mentioned in game rules). It consists of 25 cells, in a 5x5 matrix configuration. The class has also some methods to control some overview aspects of the game

  • Method Details

    • movementPossibleFromCell

      public boolean movementPossibleFromCell​(Cell cell)
      The method controls if a movement is possible from a considered cell. Santorini rules explain that a movement from a cell to another one (in normal situations) is possible only if these two are adjacent, the movement is maximum one level up and the destination cell is not at dome level. This method is private because it supports other methods of this class
      Parameters:
      cell - is the starting cell, from which possible movements must be considered
      Returns:
      true if a movement in any direction from parameter-cell is possible; otherwise, false

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(Player player)
      This method controls if a movement is possible for a considered player, with one of his workers
      Parameters:
      player - is the considered player, so the one you want to study possible movements
      Returns:
      true if a movement in any direction by one of the workers of parameter-player is possible; otherwise, false

    • getAvailableMoveCells

      public java.util.List<Cell> getAvailableMoveCells​(Worker worker)
      This methods returns all the Cells in which a worker could currently potentially move.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker whose available move cells are requested
      Returns:
      a List of the possible Cells where the Worker could move to

    • canBuild

      public boolean canBuild​(Worker worker)
      The method controls if a building is possible for a considered worker. Santorini rules explain that a worker in a cell can build (in normal situations) in an adjacent cell, increasing its level; if the adjacent cell is at dome level, building is not possible over it
      Parameters:
      worker - is the considered worker, so the one you want to study possible buildings
      Returns:
      true if a building in any direction by parameter-worker is possible; otherwise, false

    • getAvailableBuildCells

      public java.util.List<Cell> getAvailableBuildCells​(Worker worker)
      This methods returns all the Cells in which a worker could currently potentially build a new level.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker whose available build cells are requested
      Returns:
      a List of the possible Cells where the Worker could build a new level

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(int row, int col) throws InvalidCellException
      The method controls if it is possible to return a reference to a Cell of the board
      Parameters:
      row - indicates the row of the Cell requested in the board
      col - indicates the column of the Cell requested in the board
      Returns:
      a reference to the Cell requested if possible
      Throws:
      InvalidCellException - if the parameters are not valid for a Cell in the board.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overridden version of Object.toString() method, used to create a serialized JSON version of the game Board.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a serialized JSON string version of the game Board.
